meanings.sent1: The weather forecast for tomorrow looks dicey.
meanings.sent2: It's always a bit dicey to invest in the stock market.
meanings.sent3: Trying to predict the winner of the game was a dicey task.
meanings.sent4: Navigating through the dense fog was a dicey endeavor.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge was so dicey that no one dared to cross it.

meanings.definition: In a dangerous or uncertain situation
meanings.sent1: She walked dicey along the narrow path in the dark.
meanings.sent2: He drove dicey through the heavy traffic to make it to the meeting on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat balanced dicey on the edge of the table, eyeing the vase.
meanings.sent4: The hiker moved dicey across the slippery rocks near the waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The acrobat performed the trick dicey, keeping the audience on the edge of their seats.
